net.tridentsdk.api.scheduling

    public abstract class TridentRunnable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancels the task and removes from execution.
      int getId()
      Used internally to refer to this runnable, probably shouldn't be used by plugins
      long getInterval()
      Gets how long between runs this is supposed to wait if it is a repeating task WARNING: This is a delegated function.
      Task getTask()
      The scheduled representation of the runnable
      boolean isInAHurry()
      Returns if this runnable is in a hurry, usually indicating that the server is shutting down
      void markSchedule(Task task)
      Invoked by the scheduler to mark that the task has been scheduled.
      void prerunSync()
      Guaranteed to be run before this Runnable on the main thread, even if this runnable is going to be run asynchronously, useful for collecting resources to work on.
      void runAfterAsync()
      Runs after this runnable has finished, asynchronously
      void runAfterSync()
      Runs after this runnable has finished, synchronously
      void setInterval(long interval)
      Sets how long this runnable should wait between executions if this is a repeating task
      boolean usesInAHurry()
      Should be reimplemented by a runnable if it wants to use in a hurry

        public TridentRunnable()

    • Method Detail

      • isInAHurry

        public boolean isInAHurry()
        Returns if this runnable is in a hurry, usually indicating that the server is shutting down

      • prerunSync

        public void prerunSync()
        Guaranteed to be run before this Runnable on the main thread, even if this runnable is going to be run asynchronously, useful for collecting resources to work on.

      • runAfterAsync

        public void runAfterAsync()
        Runs after this runnable has finished, asynchronously

      • runAfterSync

        public void runAfterSync()
        Runs after this runnable has finished, synchronously

      • cancel

        public final void cancel()
        Cancels the task and removes from execution. See Task.cancel() WARNING: This is a delegated function. DO NOT call this method before it is scheduled. A NullPointerException will be thrown. This can be called when getTask() != null.

      • getInterval

        public final long getInterval()
        Gets how long between runs this is supposed to wait if it is a repeating task WARNING: This is a delegated function. DO NOT call this method before it is scheduled. A NullPointerException will be thrown. This can be called when getTask() != null.

      • setInterval

        public final void setInterval(long interval)
        Sets how long this runnable should wait between executions if this is a repeating task

        If this task is synchronous to the main thread, the change will be immediate, if it is not, the change may take an iteration to take effect, however getInterval() will reflect the changes immediately

        WARNING: This is a delegated function. DO NOT call this method before it is scheduled. A NullPointerException will be thrown. This can be called when getTask() != null.

      • getId

        public final int getId()
        Used internally to refer to this runnable, probably shouldn't be used by plugins

      • usesInAHurry

        public boolean usesInAHurry()
        Should be reimplemented by a runnable if it wants to use in a hurry

        Reimplement to return true

      • getTask

        public Task getTask()
        The scheduled representation of the runnable
        Returns:
        the Task object held within the scheduling implementation

      • markSchedule

        public void markSchedule(Task task)
        Invoked by the scheduler to mark that the task has been scheduled.
        Parameters:
        task - the task handed down to delegate off functionality
